quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Zebra and Frogs
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, zebra, function. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Do frogs have gills?
This type of ant is considered the most venomous of all insects.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack jumper ant

questions.question: Which one of these is not a species of zebra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Savanna Zebra

questions.question: The largest ant colony is located on the Ishikari coast of Hokkaido. Approximately how many ants are there in this colony?
There are frogs that can fly (or make fly-like movements)
This type of ant causes a lot of allergic reactions in the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire ant

questions.question: Can a zebra be ridden if trained properly?
How tall is a typical zebra at the shoulder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 feet (1.2 m)

questions.question: How many species of zebra are known to exist?
Frogs can breathe underwater.
Zebras are related to rhinos.
How fast can a zebra run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 40 mph (65 km/h)

questions.question: How long can a zebra live in captivity?
Which of these are not a function of a zebras stripes?

options.text: A warning sign to other zebras

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A warning sign to other zebras

questions.question: About how long have ants been around on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 60 million years

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Ants and Flamingos
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, parts, s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is special about the red ants of the Southwestern USA and Central and South America?

options.text: They can live in temperatures from 11 degrees Centigrade to 51 degrees Centigrade.
They can live for six days without food or water.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They steal larvae for slaves.

questions.question: What do we call the type of ants that plant seeds to grow food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvester ants

questions.question: Which statement about ants is untrue?

options.text: Anteaters prefer ants to any other type of food.
An ant colony will eat its own larvae if there is no other food around.
Bullet ants are considered to have the most painful sting.
Ants are sometimes put into Thai salads.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anteaters prefer ants to any other type of food.

questions.question: What do you call a group of flamingos?
Warner Brothers highest grossing film of 1954 was about enormous ants that threatened a small town in the USA. What was the title of this movie?
A flamingo’s feathers can change color depending on its diet.
All flamingos have 12 black flight feathers at the tips of each wing.
Are baby flamingos pink?
Which of these flamingo species is not native to the Americas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lesser Flamingo

questions.question: What are the three basic parts of an ants body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Head, mesosoma, metasoma

questions.question: Carpenter ants have become a problem because of the wood they eat.
How many species of flamingo are native to the Americas?
In 1966 was found the first ant fossil. From which geological period did it come from?
All of these substances but one are a safe way to get rid of ants in the house. Which is the odd one?
Why do flamingos often stand on one leg?

options.text: To keep their feet from becoming waterlogged.
To keep feet from getting tired.
To stir up as little silt from bottom as possible.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noone knows for sure.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Thylacines and Pangolin
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, mean, pangolins. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Why were Thylacines called Tigers?

options.text: because of the vicious way in which they killed their prey
because of the stripes on their back

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because of the stripes on their back

questions.question: Once the dingo was introduced to Australia, the Thylacine population decreased steadily until the only viable populations were on the Island of Tasmania.
What was the name of the zoo in which the last known Thylacine was placed in 1936?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hobart Zoo

questions.question: When was the last reported killing of a Thylacine in Australia?
The tongue of a pangolin is so long that it is anchored to its pelvis.
What does the Malaysian word pangolin mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roll into a ball

questions.question: In 1984 what famous mogul offered a $100,000 reward for proof of the continued existence of Thylacines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Turner

questions.question: It was proven that Thylacines killed some sheep in 1957.
What decade did the pop culture icon the plastic lawn flamingo come into existence?
What was the fine for shooting a Thylacine?
Are Thylacines marsupials?
What is a pangolin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A scaly ant-eating mammal

questions.question: Pangolins have no teeth.
Was there ever any evidence found after 1936 that Thylacines may have still been living in Australia?
In what year were Thylacines classified as extinct?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Pangolins and Animals
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, pangolins, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Can pangolins walk on their hind legs?
Which of the following statements about snakes is not true?

options.text: Snakes can strike upto half their length.
A fully grown king cobra can rear up so it looks a human in the eyes.
Not all venomous snakes are capable of killing a man.
Snakes will attack almost always they sense the presence of a human.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snakes will attack almost always they sense the presence of a human.

questions.question: If you happen to be near a big cat (e.g. lion, tiger, lynx) that seems to be about to attack you, which of the following shouldn’t you do in any case?

options.text: Try to look larger than you really are

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turn back and run

questions.question: Although not all bear subspecies are vicious, there is a tendency for increase in bear attacks due to this factor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Destruction of bears natural habitat

questions.question: Surprisingly, the number one killer among animals with about 2-3 million human fatalities a year is a tiny insect. Which is it?
We’ve seen these animals as friendly and approachable but the truth is that they’re unpredictable. What is the average number of fatalities a year elephants cause?
How many young pangolins can an adult pangolin have at one time?
Despite sharks’ bad reputation thanks to movies out of 300 species of sharks only this much are known to have attacked and killed a man.
Although only a small percent of scorpions are venomous to people, 800 to 2000 human deaths each year are caused by scorpions. During which part of the day are these creatures most active?
Are pangolins related to anteaters and armadillos?

Although jellyfish may seem to you calm and harmless, an encounter with some species may leave you in excruciating pain and even kill you in minutes. Which of the following species of jellyfish is venomous enough to kill a man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Box jellyfish

questions.question: Which of these statements concerning the way in which pangolins defend themselves is false?

options.text: They spray a noxious odor like a skunk.
They curl up in a ball.
They attack by slashing their long claws or whipping their tails.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They run away very quickly.

questions.question: Crocodiles like to stay motionless in water and wait for the perfect time to strike. These powerful prehistoric creatures annually give what estimated number of fatalities?
Hippopotamuses may seem slow, lazy and bulky but in fact are one of the most dangerous African animals. Which of the following should you avoid in order to prevent a hippopotamus attack?

options.text: Standing between the hippopotamus and its calf

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The armor plates of pangolins are made of tough bone.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Species and Hyenas
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, rhino, deaths. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The species name White Rhinoceros is the result of mis-translation of the word white.
What is the #1 reason for the rhinos decline worldwide?
Which of these is not a species of hyena?
How many species of rhinoceros survive in the wild?
Are male hyenas the dominant members of their groups?
What is the gestation period of a rhino?
In which of these African environments are hyenas NOT found?
Which of these is NOT a species of rhinoceros?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: African Rhino

questions.question: The deaths caused by rhinos in India and Nepal exceed the total number of deaths caused by leopards and tigers.
What is the life span of a rhino?
Hyenas were domesticated and eaten in ancient Egypt.
Throughout the period from the 1970s to the end of the 20th century, the rhinoceros numbers declined by approximately what percentage?
Hyenas are most closely related to what creatures?
Hyenas are only found in Africa.
In Asian folklore the rhinoceros would stomp out fires in the jungle.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Moa and Hyenas
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bird, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these European countries is not home to any wild native reindeer?
According to the Medieval Bestiary hyenas have the ability to change their sex.
Is the Moa related to the kiwi, a living species of flightless bird from New Zealand?
What was the main reason for the extinction of the Moa?

options.text: It was hunted by man for food.
There was not enough room on the island for so many large birds
It could easily be caught by predators.
It got to large to support itself.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was hunted by man for food.

questions.question: Was the male Moa larger than the female?
What country was home to the Moa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand

questions.question: In what year were the first Moa remains discovered by Europeans?
Are spotted hyenas considered an endangered species?
How many species of Moa are known to have existed?
Reindeer are strict herbivores (vegetarians).
What is a group of hyenas called?
Approximately how many miles per year can the North American caribou travel?
Both male and female reindeer grow antlers.
What animal was the number one predator of the Moa?

options.text: They had no predator they were too large

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An extinct species of eagle

questions.question: The Moa was unique because even though it was a bird it had no wings.
